alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 10:54PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washburn and western Sawyer Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1053 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rice Lake, to 6 miles east of Chetek, to near Bloomer, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph, frequent lightning, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Locations impacted include... Chippewa Flowage West, Chippewa Flowage East, Round Lake, Stone Lake, Birchwood, Winter, Radisson, Exeland, Couderay, New Post, Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage, Little Round Lake, Edgewater, Ojibwa, Reserve, Northwoods Beach, Little Sissabagama Lake, Deer Lake, Sissabagama Lake, and Chippewa Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
